Most application development best practices were formed in a world of virtual machines and long-running processes.



Kubernetes fundamentally changes those runtime guaranteesâ€”applications can restart anytime, lose local state, and run behind multiple layers of abstraction.
Many production issues on Kubernetes are not caused by bad code, but by assumptions that no longer hold true.
These application development myths highlight where traditional thinking breaks when applications are deployed on Kubernetes.
Understanding these myths is essential to building resilient, cloud-native applications.
